definition: to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: This hat is so expensive that I can't afford it.
sentences.chinese: 这顶帽子贵得也太离谱了，我买不起。

sentences.english: Several writers for the Guardian have made what I believe is an unjustifiable leap.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，卫报的几位撰稿人来了个离谱的大跃进。

sentences.english: Throwing the subject in to a wider field.
Prices are exorbitantly high in this shop.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店的价格高得离谱。

sentences.english: So unreasonable was his price that everybody startled.
sentences.chinese: 他的要价太离谱，令每个人都理屈词穷。

sentences.english: But, oh, how wrong she was.
sentences.chinese: 但是，哦，她错得太离谱了。

sentences.english: Chinglish: This hat is extremely expensive, I can't buy it.
sentences.chinese: 这顶帽子贵得也太离谱了，我买不起。

sentences.english: In view of this, just as Beijing was unreasonable abuse not justified the high price.
sentences.chinese: 如此看来，单称北京的房价高得离谱儿就没有道理了。

sentences.english: Bezos was so wrong he was right.
sentences.chinese: 贝索斯正因为错得如此离谱，他才找到了正道。

sentences.english: Predictions of change in Egypt have almost always proved wrong; generally it bumbles along much as usual.
sentences.chinese: 对埃及变化的预测大多不准，一个接一个离谱如前。

sentences.english: M: My son's scores dropped quickly recently.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子的成绩最近降得很离谱。
都是价钱贵得离谱的东西，确实如此。

sentences.english: The prices here are far off track! I paid$4 for a pineapple juice.
sentences.chinese: 这里的价格太离谱了，一杯菠萝汁要4美金。

sentences.english: The price of beer here is ridiculously high.
sentences.chinese: 这儿的啤酒贵得也太离谱了。

definition: to make one's hair stand up in anger (idiom); to raise people's hackles
